title: No one bothered to record his human appearance
post: Perhaps the attraction is at least partly related to the lack of a clear record, and the imaginative possibilities that enables.
author: danielwalldammit

title: No one bothered to record his human appearance
post:
Yount wrote:  “Had the Shroud of Turin been proved to be the authentic cloth in which he was buried, it still would have offered few clues.”  That has to be one of the dumbest comments I’ve ever seen.  If the Shroud were real, it would offer few clues to what he looked like???  That’s like saying the Mars’ Rover is of little help in analyzing the surface of Mars.  Some writers don’t even seem to have a basic needed factor
:  common sense.
author: Joe Marino

title: No one bothered to record his human appearance
post: That’s funny, Joe.  I was thinking that and when I clicked reply in the e-mail but you beat me to it!  :o)  I was also thinking if he did a study of representations of Christ before the rediscovery of it (clean shaven boyish face) after the Edessa flood (more like the Shroud image), he might have some food for thought.
author: Andy Weiss
